author: djrtwo
content: This is not strictly needed. The way sync works is that you (the light client) have some trusted finalized root (from showing up with it or from a previous sync). The light server then gives you a a good aggregate lightclientvote from the next light client period (which you have the expected committee proved against your previous root). This block root they the light client voted on has a state root in it so you can then get proofs about anything else you need (latest finalized, the next light client committee for sync, etc)

author: djrtwo
content: You could cut out some proof overhead in sync by including additional fields explicitly but only marginally
